block.p: Nancy McDonnell Maloney, a retired lawyer, and Jacob Berry Underhill III, a retired insurance executive, were married on Tuesday. Beverly S. Cohen, a retired New York State Supreme Court justice, officiated at her office in New York.

The bride, 57, will keep her name. She retired as a senior staff lawyer at the Florida Department of Children and Families. She was an assistant public defender in Brevard County, Fla., and the division chief for juveniles of the 18th Judicial Circuit there. She graduated from New York University and received a master's in administration of higher and adult education from Columbia and a law degree from Rutgers.

Nancy McDonnell Maloney, a retired lawyer, and Jacob Berry Underhill III, a retired insurance executive, were married on Tuesday. Beverly S. Cohen, a retired New York State Supreme Court justice, officiated at her office in New York.

Nancy McDonnell Maloney, a retired lawyer, and Jacob Berry Underhill III, a retired insurance executive, were married on Tuesday. Beverly S. Cohen, a retired New York State Supreme Court justice, officiated at her office in New York.

The bride, 57, will keep her name. She retired as a senior staff lawyer at the Florida Department of Children and Families. She was an assistant public defender in Brevard County, Fla., and the division chief for juveniles of the 18th Judicial Circuit there. She graduated from New York University and received a master's in administration of higher and adult education from Columbia and a law degree from Rutgers.
She is a daughter of Edna McDonnell Maloney of Cocoa Beach, Fla., and the late Edward Joseph Maloney.

The bridegroom, 80, retired as the president of New York Life Insurance Company, a post he held from 1981 to 1986. He was first deputy superintendent of insurance of New York State and the chairman of Manhattan Eye, Ear and Throat Hospital. He graduated from Princeton.
He is a son of Dorothy Quinn Major, who lived in Palm Beach, Fla., and J. Berry Underhill Jr., who lived in New York.
The bride's two previous marriages and the bridegroom's three previous marriages ended in divorce.
